website_summaries.verdict: The Zircon Edge Finder is a more affordable alternative to higher end electronic models, but it does require some patience. Several scans may be necessary, but the results are reliable.
pros: Special light draws arrow on targets
Penetrates varying thicknesses of different wall materials
Also has AC wire finding option
cons: Requires several passes to find stud edges
Prone to false readings caused by electronic interference
Better at finding studs than joists

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously inaccurate device!
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it 0 stars but I can't. This finder is the least accurate I have ever used. Out of the box the unit kept giving me inconsistent indications of where the stud edge was. Consecutive readings showed 1/4" ~ 1/2" variances on where the stud edge was. I ended up drilling test holes with a small bit to actually find the stud edge. It was 1/2" from the most accurate indication that this finder gave. Ridiculously inaccurate device. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very inaccurate!
customer_reviews.text: The worst stud finder I've ever used! It detects studs where there are none, doesn't detect studs where there are!
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: does the job, but very tempermental
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost, this does find studs in walls, which it is supposed to do. It is easy to use, in that you put in the battery, press and hold the button, and slide the device along the wall and wait for it to beep and for the arrow to light up. The irritating part is that it regularly gives an error message and sound, causing you to have to reset it and re-slide it. That is easy enough to do and definitely is not the end of the world, it just makes using it irritating and take longer than it needs to.
customer_reviews.author: KC-Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Haven't been able to find any studs
customer_reviews.text: My walls are painted with a texture coating, so the device doesn't slide smoothly. Even with a new (good till 2023) 9V battery, neither setting seems to be able find a stud (nor AC wires). After purchasing a 49" TV for the living room, I was hoping to mount a 32" TV in the bedroom. Got a can of spackle and a putty knife, so I guess I'll start drilling holes.
customer_reviews.author: Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Should have saved my money...hunt and peck better.
customer_reviews.text: It was difficult to impossible to hold it level against the wall and keep the button pressed. Working with a fresh Duracell alkaline battery that read 9.16v under "deep scan" load with button pressed, my studs were supposedly ~3" wide...right! Well I drilled into air. The tool is clumsy, hard to use and inaccurate. The ergonomics are pathetic and the indications are inconsistent.
customer_reviews.author: WH7QQ

customer_reviews.title: Reliability. Finding a stud when doing repairs on my house.
customer_reviews.text: Today was the second time I wanted to use this tool and the second time it did not work. It seems to get stuck on 'deepscan' showing a full arrow, blinking, and that's all. I am very disappointed in this tool, would not buy it again, nor recommend it to a friend. I would return it if I could, however the return window is closed. Bummed One star was required and too much for a tool that doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Shear

customer_reviews.title: EDGE FINDER, The tool will find the edge, you will find the center.
customer_reviews.text: The most important thing to realize is this finds the EDGE, not the center, THE EDGE. The second most important thing; hold the finder parallel to the studs you're looking to find the edges of. This will typically mean vertically for wall studs. As the directions state, sweep from both sides and find the edges from each side, the center point between the 2 marks will be the best place to drill. Check the distance between the two marks to ensure it logically fits the width of a wall stud and then also find 2 other studs and check the distance apart. Each stud should be the same width and each should typically be the same distance from the others.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: As most homeowners are aware, electrical outlets are attached to studs. Therefore, the wires leading to the outlet are attached to the same stud. I practiced with this unit to view the display of a stud with and without wires attached. I prefer to use studs without the wires running along the side of the stud. However, that isn't always an option. I was installing a TV mount on the wall and needed to support the weight of the mount and a 55" TV. Once I was comfortable with the displays, I hit the studs every time. Read the instructions and practice a little before you start drilling.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P Carmean

customer_reviews.title: Please don not buy lol.
customer_reviews.text: Worst stud finder you could ever dream of. Others wrote similar comments, but I just assumed it was user error. Indicator goes off or a normal scan and marks a "stud". Then you hit drywall. 20 holes later you realize its as trust worthy as a con artist. Waste you're money if you want for you thought like me, in which you though it had to be user error.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Does Not Work--Do Not Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Did not find any of the studs in the wall. I read the instructions and even watched a YouTube video on how to operate this. I found the studs the old-fashioned way, by gently tapping on the drywall with a rubber mallet and listening to the reverberation. This "stud finder" was a total waste of $22.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Zircon studfinder with hopes that it would make my task easy. Nope. I ran the device over 1/2 drywall looking for studs. Several times. I even went over studs I knew where they were located and the device never located them. I put in fresh battery. No good. I had my wife try. Nope. I ended up having to use a tape measure, went on the assumption, 16 inch on center and punched a hole in the wall using the hammer and nail method to find the stud. Totally waste of $26 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Trash!!! Get something else.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago just to have when I needed, maybe used it about 3 times. Had saved it for a few months and today it does NOT work, it just lights up, stays on flashing "StudDeepScan" on Stud setting and it does not clear up. Tried it several times different areas, replaced the battery and it does the same thing. What a piece of trash.
customer_reviews.author: Aztlan

customer_reviews.title: Efficient and cost effective
customer_reviews.text: Great aid in finding studs, headers and any wood to which drywall is attached with by steel/iron-based fasteners, typically screws. Can be used without any other finding tool, but I use it with a stud finder to help eliminate the false negatives and false positives that often occur with stud finders. If the stud finder reports a stud AND this tool locates the fasteners associated with the stud, then you can be sure that you have truly found a stud. Otherwise, you can't ever be truly certain because stud finders can be inaccurate and the worst can be so inaccurate as to render them worse than useless. Great product. I'd give it 10 stars if Amazon offered that option.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Schlenker

customer_reviews.title: Better To Have, Than Not Have
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a wood stud behind drywall, this tool is worth having. When using it to find studs behind 1/2" textured drywall the edge location consistency was variable by 1in. This tool required repeating the scans many times and patience, but mostly works. The wire warning indicator alert went off many times where there are no wires in the wall. The wire warning alert was useless.
customer_reviews.author: G. Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Stud finder bust
customer_reviews.text: Could not find studs consistently through 1/2 inch drywall!! Even tried deepscan but no go!! Too many false reading ( Verrified by gaping holes with no studs) in wall where the alarm was! Would have been better off drilling a 1/2 hole in center where I wanted to mount the TV stand, used my scope with iPhone adapter to find my studs! Once done repeat he and paint even though it’s behind bracket! I have used better!!
customer_reviews.author: Berns

customer_reviews.title: Found a stud where the magnet stud finder couldn't find any nails
customer_reviews.text: The A100 model worked really well for me. This week I had to mount several "L" brkts as a safety for 5 ea 6' tall bookshelves. I used both my magnetic nail finder and the A100. The readings that both gave were in agreement except in one location where there just had to be a stud, but I couldn't find any nails. Once I received the A100 Zircon, it found the elusive stud in no time. Every hole I made found a solid footing into a stud. I'm convinced of the Zircon's value. I also really like that it located electrical wiring.
customer_reviews.author: calintexas

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Being a contractor for 25 years I know how to calibrate a stud sensor... this is the biggest piece of junk I’ve ever bought!!! I wished I could get my money back!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bryon Margo

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, innacurate
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. The five star reviews have to be bought. The ones that mention caution and measure/check twice cut or drill once. Still put as many holes in the wall as you want this thing couldnt find a stud in a lumber yard. False positive after false positive means this things in the trash and I wasted my money. I have used this for a few projects, i have checked and rechecked and everytime I have drilled I haven't found a stud.
customer_reviews.author: James Poppe

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: So far it is one of my favorite products. It is more sensitive than other stud sensor I had in the past. Keep in mind that it will require the right touch when using it, so I recommend to practice with it as much as you can if you don’t have a lot of experience with these tools. I am not giving 5 stars because it came without batteries, so I couldn’t test it right away. Keep in mind that you will need batteries to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Alanis Sophia

customer_reviews.title: get a better one
customer_reviews.text: for the money, this works. we were able to find the studs in the wall but sometimes it showed them and other times it didn't. We made a few holes more then we needed to because of this. It never reported a stud when it was not there... but it did not always report the ones that were there. I dont know why or how that happens but combining that with the knowledge that 'most' studs go from floor to ceiling... it got the small improvement jobs done. but get a better one if you can't handle a little frustration with your projects
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Vital to Prevent Wall Anchor Destruction
customer_reviews.text: Gives an accurate idea of where wall studs are located. If you don't use this before trying to set a screw in a hollow wall and you hit a stud, your wall anchor will likely destroy the sheetrock. If you know where the stud is, you will know where to just use a screw with no anchor. Many wall anchors will bend back towards screwdriver if you hit a stud or beam. This often enlarges the hole past repair, or even crumbles the drywall (and wallpaper). I always blamed the anchor type. Possible but no, usually a wooden stud or beam is behind the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Shaw

customer_reviews.title: For $19.97 it is a great stud finder, worked perfect.
customer_reviews.text: For $19.97 it is a great stud finder, old conventional ways to find a stud in my house don't work, magnets, tapping, etc, forget it. This thing worked great. I have additional work done after it was originally built so of course the stud distance was different in this section of the house. Also some of the original build had some minor discrepancies where you couldn't just measure out from a corner once you knew the stud distance. Highly recommended! So stop knocking holes in your walls and just get one.
customer_reviews.author: t7

customer_reviews.title: Finds studs, easy to read mark.
customer_reviews.text: I like the easy to ready arrow that displays when a stud is found. I tested it on a blank unpainted wall and it found all the studs with no problems. It's really easy to mark the wall now for the stud. Ofcourse, there are tricks to using these that might throw people off and call them useless. Biggest is to make sure the device is clear with no readings on the wall and then move it across the wall. Don't start with a sensor read or error. There are limits to these and they are just a tool. But this one seems to be working just fine.
customer_reviews.author: MNPilot

customer_reviews.title: Not confident
customer_reviews.text: Gave me no confidence at all when drilling holes. I set to deep scan as I wanted to avoid electrical cables but it bleeped in a certain area then never bleeped when I tried it in the same area again, but then when i tried it again it bleeped then it did not bleep the next 4 or 5 times in the same area. Then it bleeped in an area it never bleeped before. I gave up and drilled a hole where I wanted in the end and hoped for the best.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Russell

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. I had no problems with using this stud finder. After about an hour research trying to look for a Stud finder on amazon, I decided to go with a familiar brand. There are so many random name brands for stud finders out there, sometimes even for identical products. This one was a simple standard choice for me and it works.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Lu

customer_reviews.title: Accurate locating of studs is easy with this tool
customer_reviews.text: Using a stud locator really is easy if one reads the directions first - and the directions with this handy device are clearly written and easy to follow. I put a fresh 9volt battery in, noting the correct polarity, and practiced locating wall studs on rough as well as smooth walls. I compared my old method of "knock knock who's there" to this device - and I was off at least an inch one way or another. The wiring detector is fairly sensitive, but helpful to determine if a wire is coming to a switch from above or below the switch, I think. Well worth the money for this helpful tool.
customer_reviews.author: Pomaikai

customer_reviews.title: Great for home DIYers
customer_reviews.text: I've used this to mount shelving, repair drywall, etc. Although it, sometimes, won't "settle" properly (i.e., doesn't detect anything or complains (beeps) for no reason), more often than not, it finds the stud's start and end with little ado. Even when it has problems, I just release the power button, and try again; sometimes, it's my fault for not holding it flush against the wall or moving before it's ready, so, I can't fault it for that! A must for all home DIYers!
customer_reviews.author: Skaizun

customer_reviews.title: Didn't miss
customer_reviews.text: Zircon StudSensor e50 arrived on time and well packaged. First use was installing a wall cabinet for a friend. The cabinet is particle board, which sucks, and therefore needed plenty of support. Using the e50 StudSensor, 3 studs were located, measured, and the cabinet pre-drilled. All nine screws (3 in each stud) went into studs. That cabinet is securely attached. No repositioning, which would have weakened the installation, was needed. My friend and I were impressed. Removed the guesswork from locating studs.
customer_reviews.author: R PrestonTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worked
customer_reviews.text: Im 28 and a female ,, i installed my tv mount to the wall and put my 40 inch tv up by myself. I found the wooden studs in my room wall easily with this device. You need to do it a few times to make certain it goes off in the correct area. Dont put your finger near the sensor!!. Also, sometimes the sensor messes up if u pick it up , best approach is left to right or vise versa.
customer_reviews.author: Quel

customer_reviews.title: Broke with minimal usage
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this a little over a year ago (14 months ago). Used it twice. Got it out to use for the third time today and it wont find a stud and gives an error. I thought the battery may have been dead so i changed it and its still broken. Cant recommend. I will be ordering a different brand this time
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: didn't work well for me at all.
customer_reviews.text: tried to install some shelves and purchased it for that purpose, when I actually used it there was no stud found over a 10' wall and we all know that's impossible. I knew there had to be one at each end of the wall so, I measured off 18" & 24" used a small nail to see which measurement it turned out to be (18") then ran the finder above the nail - no result. I moved over 18" and still did not show a stud but my nail did.
customer_reviews.author: Alan L

customer_reviews.title: IT works like Magic!!
customer_reviews.text: Needed something cheap for a one-time job, turns out this thing is magic! now use it for almost every job. The only downside is the 9v battery, wished it was something rechargable or AA batteries instead. Works just as described! Haven't had any issues so far Highly Recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Hassan

customer_reviews.title: kinda ok
customer_reviews.text: I think i should have spent more and got something better. It works on some walls and on some it doesn't the ones with thick paint or the stud being a little away from the wall, even the deep scan doesn't works well. Next time I will buy something better
customer_reviews.author: Kaleem

customer_reviews.title: Works, but only when it works !
customer_reviews.text: It has a hard time finding studs under less than optimum conditions. Even under optimum conditions it has completely gotten it wrong, causing me to put extra holes into my dry wall. I would definitely have gotten a different stud finder having this experience with it over past few days. Save yourself the trouble and find something that works better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The problem is probably with me
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, studs used to be easier to find when I was younger! But seriously, this feels nice to use, the screen is easy to read and I understand that it can pick up various things that lurk behind the walls, not just the studs. Given all that, it drives me mad to use this because not once could I get the same result when I tried to recapture the mark from both the left and the right. Result: my mirror is still not up on the wall and I am waiting for maybe a real life expert to help me figure out how to use this reliably.
customer_reviews.author: Cinderella Finds Her Own Shoe

customer_reviews.title: I am glad they make this
customer_reviews.text: This works very well. I used it to find the studs in the wall of my old house. I was able to put shelves on my walls with screws that went into the plaster and the studs in the wall. You need to move it reasonably fast over the wall to find the studs. Then it shows shapes on the little screen and it shines a red light in the center when you have this unit perfectly aligned with the stud. Then yoiu can mark the spot on the wall and drill a hole in the wall and into the stud you just found with this unit. I am glad they make this.
customer_reviews.author: ewd

customer_reviews.title: Cautiously optimistic...
customer_reviews.text: Inconsistent readings are sometimes a concern, so it’s best to check the entirety of the wall to get a better feel for what’s behind the wall. Works accurately 70% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Miss B

customer_reviews.title: No battery inside!! Be aware of it before you buy
customer_reviews.text: It requied a spercific 9V alkaline battery but it ship in with no box, no battery, no wrapping. Only the instruction and the reader itself. I tried all my AA, AAA, AAAA battery, none of them can fit into the reader!! As I read the instruction, it requied a 9V battery that not include! So I searched on Amazon it requied extra $7 and 2 days to get it working, DO NOT BUY if you don't have 9v battery in hand.
customer_reviews.author: Yao

customer_reviews.title: A bit finicky but it does the trick and seems quite accurate
customer_reviews.text: This device is a bit flaky which is why I am giving 4 stars rather than 5. It did end up finding studs but it took about 10 tries before it wanted to function properly. I would not trust a first reading but go over anything several times. That being said I was able to get my ceiling hook bike hanger installed once it wanted to function. Oh and I didn't see anything in operating instructions about this but if your other hand is ANYWHERE near this device it will start reading studs all over the place, be careful to keep your off-hand well away.
customer_reviews.author: Jammin

customer_reviews.title: Works about half the time
customer_reviews.text: The accuracy is highly variable. It is hit and miss on finding studs. If I use it repeatedly on the same spot, I get results that vary for more than inch. It is frustrating to use the stud sensor and then miss the stud with a screw or nail. Just for the record, "nearly hitting a stud" doesn't cut it when putting up shelves and such. Simply not a quality product that you can count on.
customer_reviews.author: ProfessorTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: ... under the photos of this product listed on amazon good product, lots of features gets the job done ...
customer_reviews.text: got some heavy paintings hanged up on the walls and will look forward to use on garage later for putting up shelves make sure you watch the video under the photos of this product listed on amazon good product, lots of features gets the job done good weight and craftsmanship to it I liked the value and design of the product
customer_reviews.author: toyotaboyz19

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Made putting my tv mount on the wall a breeze. Have put 3 tvs mounts up since purchasing this. Pros Works Easy to use Makes sure I don't electrocute myself 🤣 Cons Manual shows a bit of features that may be outdated or for another model. Not really a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander R.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage save your money
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd zircon stud finder and once again im dissapointed. If i could sue for my time wasted and drilling unnecessary holes i swear i would. This is a garbage device and should be taken off of amazon asap
customer_reviews.author: gregy styles

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this to install a TV wall mount. ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to install a TV wall mount. This seems to do the job okay. I needed to do several passes to identify a stud - basically took an average. I wonder if a more expensive model would offer more consistent results? Even so, this should suffice for basic do-it-yourself projects.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: inconsistent in stud detection
customer_reviews.text: I plan on installing a TV mounting brackets on the wall and wanted to do it myself. After a lot of research, I decided on this model, based on the reviews. I read the instructions carefully and also watched some instructional videos. Unfortunately, results are very inconsistent, and I tried with both scanning modes and against two different walls (one is likely to have a thicker dry wall). Due to results being so inconsistent, I don't even attempt to drill a hole.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: I didn't find this stud finder.... it found me. All in all it's semi accurate. It's range is usually an inch and a half... So, you have to somewhat make an educated guess. I usually go back to the center of where it started until when it ends, but that's not always a winner. I eventually find something, maybe after and extra hole.... or two. Eh?
customer_reviews.author: Robb Bancroft

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This is the second stud finder I order from Amazon because the first one was beeping all over the wall so I returned it and ordered this one and so far I'm happy with this stud finder. Update it's not looking good or there's no studs in a wall that I try to mount a shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: Complete trash avoid
customer_reviews.text: Total garbage, if it is to be believed then my beams are zigzaging and moving my the minute, just buy literally anything else. I will be either returning mine or shooting it as the satisfaction may be worth the $20 loss
customer_reviews.author: Sir M.

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I did research for a stud finder online. This brand was best economical brand. I was hanging a tv on wall so needed it to be accurate. I tried it several times around the same area on different days to determine its accuracy. It was the same result more or less each time. Highly recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: Simple and easy to use. For far too long I suffered with the cheap magnet version of a stud finder. These things are amazing. They zoom in on the exact spot the stud starts and finishes. Whereas the magnet versions are keying off on the nail, so you have to guess where the actual wood stud is. This baby also will alert you to the presence of electrical wires. And it has a deep mode for different types of walls, construction, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK!! SCAM PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware, this does not find wood beams on regular Sheetrock. Im inclined to believe all of these ratings are false. After drilling 6 holes in the wall, I gave up and grabbed plaster and paint to cover up all the unnecessary damaged caused by this products inability to find a stud.
customer_reviews.author: vanesita

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Not accurate please don't buy it, you have been warn. I drilled so many holes thanks to this.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Really sad that this didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Really sad that this didn't work. I was really hopeful for this item. I tried using it to find the studs but it was just so inconsistent was was very difficult to find studs when it did. I would follow the directions exactly, but it didn't help it work any better. Sometimes I would have it on stud scan and it would find a stud. I would then turn it off and try to find the same exact stud again and then it wouldn't find it. I ended up buying the CH Hanson 03040 Magnetic Stud Finder instead and that worked like a charm. So I will be returning this item.
customer_reviews.author: Shaquillle A.

customer_reviews.title: Seller easy to work with
customer_reviews.text: Arrived and I put in a new battery and didn't work. Bought another new batter and still didn't work. Seller was easy to work with. Made it very easy to return and get a refund. We all have issues but this seller really works with you when things don't go well.
customer_reviews.author: John W Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: This is my first wall stud finder. I have seen negative review on Amazon and was hesitated to try. Later, I gave this product a shot. I bought it and test it. It worked great and I like its accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Bungheng

customer_reviews.title: Stud finder? More like junk finder.
customer_reviews.text: This product is a waste. Even after watching several YouTube videos the accuracy was off. After a month the battery died. A replacement battery was soon drained within a few days. The on/off setting seems to be not working correctly. If you do purchase, remove the battery out of the unit when keeping in storage.
customer_reviews.author: mussronkey547

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Drains the battery after a handful of uses
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and figure out, even for this chick! However, after just a handful of uses, the fresh-from-the-package battery I installed was already running low. For something used so infrequently, the battery life should be much longer in my opinion. Heck, smoke detectors which use the same 9 volt, last a year!
customer_reviews.author: Book__Nerd

customer_reviews.title: Now it's too late and is tossed in the garbage. Wish I would have spent more and bought ...
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Does not work. Won't calibrate, just sits there trying to calibrate. I wish I would have used it directly after buying, as I would have returned it. Now it's too late and is tossed in the garbage. Wish I would have spent more and bought a proper stud finder.
customer_reviews.author: Twelvizm

customer_reviews.title: i think my one is broken. it constantly beeps and all leds are always on
customer_reviews.text: the flash symbol, an arrow, ready leds are always on when i power it on. using a charged 9V battery. It beeps when i hold it in the air. I held it to a wall for 2 minutes and no changes. it doesnt seem to calibrate
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: I didn't particularly like this stud finder
customer_reviews.text: I didn't particularly like this stud finder. Like most electronic stud finders, its bound to have false-positives but this one seemed to have way too many. I ended up returning this product after about 8 total frustrating hours and multiple drilled holes in the wall. I tried holding it in every conceivable way to make sure I wasn't holding it wrong but it still went off like crazy. Maybe I had a faulty one? It was built very nice for the price but oh well...
customer_reviews.author: M. Hubert

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stud finder to mount my 60 in TV. It worked really well, so far no issues. Maybe I didn’t read the description well enough but it does NOT come with the batter it needs (9v) I ended up buying a 2 pack of these batteries at target for like $8
customer_reviews.author: Javanna Latham

customer_reviews.title: This works very well
customer_reviews.text: This does a very good job finding studs in the wall (shows where both edges start and Finds studs and it helps keep you out of trouble by showing a lightning bolt when it finds electrical wires. Well worth the price !
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Don’t trust online version of product.
customer_reviews.text: Returned due to unreliable readings. Had a contractor double check that it wasn’t user error (as he had the same model) and it was the device. Going to go buy it at Home Depot or Lowe’s In person and pay the extra 5-10 for a working one.
customer_reviews.author: Emery

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was hoping for.....
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the package with new battery the unit is very erratic. The screen is very glitchy and not reliable. I find I have to stop and reset the unit in a different location several times and pass over the area looking for the studs multiple times to find center and trust it is accurate. For the 45+ dollars I dont see much better performance from this unit vs my old "Crapsman" stud finder, or should I say Stud "may" Finder.....
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Did not if it calibrate correctly.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions on the bottom of the unit tell the user to "place the tool against the surface to be scanned. then Press and Hold the Power Button. When Spotlite Pointer flashes and tool beeps, tool is calibrated and ready for use". The tool never beeped. I tested the battery and the battery was at 100%. I was going to work in an area where there were electrical wires, but since I could not confirm that the tool had calibrated properly I was not able to complete the job. This unit is NOT a cheap unit. This is the 1st time I tried to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim D

customer_reviews.title: Locates air perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Trash, directions are simple. The performance is trash. I tried both modes. Gave me the so called "stud" 5 times. Drilled a hile and hit air. Tried again after trying multiole times...yes slowly. Hit fiberglass. I was not going to return it but trash like this, i deserve my money back.
customer_reviews.author: chris ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Zircon Stud Finder
customer_reviews.text: Real happy that it arrived so quickly - The accuracy is off but I don't believe it is due to the stud finder but the fact that there is aluminum siding on the other side of the wall where we wish to hang a security bar for our bathtub - We are working on it and I am sure it will work for other projects that we have
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Price great.
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Very easy. No regrets. Great price. Light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Trk

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the box
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome... took me a few tries to get it but now I run around the house hanging picture frames on studs by nails... no more setting anchors if i don't need something in a very specific spot.
customer_reviews.author: James Slack

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't turn on
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk. I tried it with a new battery and it didn't turn on. So I thought maybe it was the battery because it was a less reliable battery brand name. So I went out and bought a Duracell battery specifically for this item, and it still wouldn't turn on. I'm getting a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Extremely accurate edge to edge stud finder
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tool for the job. A red arrow projects on the wall at the location of the edge of the stud while at the same time progress bars come closer together as you near the edge, then join when directly over the stud, and then go apart as the device moves past the stud. A re-swipe in the opposite direction confirms the other edge. No more not knowing where the exact center of the stud is. My old Zircon is going into the charity box.
customer_reviews.author: Bill The Bob

customer_reviews.title: Bad detector that cannot detect entire stud
customer_reviews.text: The detector is subpar compared to other stub finders. It does not accurately give you studs as it detects on one point but if you go lower in the wall, it says there is no studs. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: S L

customer_reviews.title: It was terrible at finding studs
customer_reviews.text: It was terrible at finding studs, didn't find one. One could say I was using it wrong but that's definitely not the case. Bought a different one at the hardware store that functioned the same and was able to find the studs just fine.
customer_reviews.author: pedro coyt

customer_reviews.title: Just moved into a new (to us) house and had ...
customer_reviews.text: Just moved into a new (to us) house and had many things to mount... Bike hanging hooks, a mount for a 60 inch TV, etc. - I much prefer mounting to a stud and this gizmo found the studs reliably every time. I followed the advice of one other reviewer and came at the stud from both sides and was able to find the edges reliably.
customer_reviews.author: Tom N

customer_reviews.title: A what finder?
customer_reviews.text: What exactly is this supposed to find? Because it apparently isn't studs. According to this thing the studs in my house are about 6" wide and placed every 3 feet...
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy-Hard to Use
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy and you have to hold the button down on the side simultaneously dragging it across the wall in search of a stud. Very manual very lightweight and flimsy. battery operated battery not included. I never found a stud
customer_reviews.author: C'Ann

customer_reviews.title: Did not work on tile
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to find studs in the shower but was not able to get an accurate read, even with deep scan. I would not recommend this if you are trying to use it to detect studs behind tile.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Bismuth

customer_reviews.title: Bought it to replace my 20 year old one and I felt like I actually went back in time
customer_reviews.text: I was not a fan of this stud finder. Bought it to replace my 20 year old one and I felt like I actually went back in time. I kept getting multiple read where a stud was showing but I knew there wasn’t one there. I also had a small section of drywall pulled off the wall and kept running the stud finder above the hole to see if it would pickup and scan that stud and it never did. It found the two studs I needed to complete my project so I returned it as soon as I was done.
customer_reviews.author: Kaileigh M Rostis

customer_reviews.title: Great stud finder
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. I was able to mount my 70 in TV on the wall with no issues of finding the stud. I recommend buying. One note. To find the center of the stud I scanned on both sides of the stud marking the edge on both sides. Then I was able to to find the middle from that
customer_reviews.author: BaTo

customer_reviews.title: Great stud finder
customer_reviews.text: This stud finder is just as easy to use as they advertised. It works well and does find the edge of the stud which is great because now you know your drilling into the center of a stud. This stud finder is very accurate and precise even has a nifty little notch to be able to mark the stud edges
customer_reviews.author: Matt G

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioned
customer_reviews.text: The stud finder indicated that everything was a stud, any surface you put the stud finder on it would alert. (Not that my son didn’t appreciate this! LOL) In addition, it was very lightweight and felt rather flimsy. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: BHNY

customer_reviews.title: Deep scan is a joke!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to find the joists in my home. Fixing a squeaky floor over the garage. I just laid brand new carpet and didn't want to rip it all out. The deep scan feature is useless. It's just flashing lights. Maybe use it at Christmas!!
customer_reviews.author: Kellie Medina

customer_reviews.title: Great basic stud finder!
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic. Much more reliable then the old stud finder my dad had given me for free. The old electronic one kept getting confused by wires or random things behind the drywall. This stud finder was able to replicate itself Everytime! And really does seem to be very accurate, mounting my TV wall mount was cake with this tool!
customer_reviews.author: KingChoup17

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I needed one. Put in my drawer And did not use it right away. When I did use it, it did not accurately find studs. Now I have holes in my wall...disappointed. It had one job.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Smith

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and accurate. Well constructed with clear readout screen. This is the best stud finder you can buy in this price range! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Hopalong

customer_reviews.title: A must for any homeowner!
customer_reviews.text: I've been debating getting one of these for years, and kept telling myself I should save the money and just keep knocking on the wall hoping to find a stud. This is WELL WORTH the low cost, and I would never go back. The "live wire" feature is a great bonus, and it has made hanging art around the house so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: VERY good stud finder and electrical wire
customer_reviews.text: Works really well thru paneling, and thru 1/2 sheetrock. Spots stud edges without fail, so far. Also, locates electrical wires if within a couple of inches of sheetrock. Very easy to understand and use.
customer_reviews.author: EGH923

customer_reviews.title: New is Not Better
customer_reviews.text: My wife purchased this unit for me as a gift with better features than my old unit. My old Zircon Studsensor 2 works as good or better than this one finding studs. It does kind of sort of find electrical lines. It does not slide over textured walls easily.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Great price, easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget is awesome!! I have an older home with textured plaster walls. It amazingly finds studs and electrical wires with that rough surface! Has been a life saver!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Lingo

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a stud finder that work!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 stud finders I’ve purchased over the years. None of them worked very well. This one is different. It totally works! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba751

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate, inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible stud finder. I gave it a 2nd star because it actually found a stud once, but over all it was incredibly inconsistent and inaccurate. The the center point is about 3/8th inch off in both directions of center, which is completely unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Bruzdzinski

customer_reviews.title: Holes holes an more holes an no wood😣very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is junk I made like 10 holes in my wall before I hit wood. Good thing I used my smallest drill bit. Sent that junk right back to the company maybe I got a defective one but as for me I’m staying away from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and accurate. It’s nice that it senses the edge of the stud as well so you can get the screw right in the middle of the stud. Battery seems to be lasting and it works well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Stud Finder - Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This stud finder is very easy to use and easy to mark the arrows. Have used around the house many times and the accuracy has been there every time. Note the wire finder will only find exposed wires so don’t blindly assume you don’t have a wire when you are using this on the lower section of walls.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Gets a little confused by screws near sheetrock seams and 120v wires near the surface of the sheetrock. But knowing that I was able to identify every beam that I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Why spend $50+ when you can spend $20?
customer_reviews.text: There are much fancier tools designed for the same job, but I'm ultimately glad that I didn't shell out for them. This helped us find the edges of vertical studs just fine through both plaster and drywall, as long as you follow the instructions in the very helpful video and come at them from both sides. I can't speak to the accuracy of the AC detection because I didn't encounter any wires during our use.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Q

customer_reviews.title: Works just ok
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work on standard dry wall but very difficult on older plaster walls
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Just as unreliable as other reviews suggest. Replaced with a different brand but similar electronic scanning finder that actually works reliably. Do not recommend this one at all.
customer_reviews.author: George McBay

customer_reviews.title: Very Affordable
customer_reviews.text: An Electronic Wall Scanner / Edge Finding Stud Finder / Live AC WireWarning Detection capability is must-have for homeowners and renters. It takes the guesswork out of measuring and hanging items. This product worked great for me when installing my household projects.
customer_reviews.author: Sobudaimae

customer_reviews.title: Basically OK
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work OK but at times disagrees with itself. There may be a valid reason for this, but as in measuring, check twice cut once.
customer_reviews.author: bigD

product_meta.title: Zircon Stud Finder DIY/Pro StudSensor A100 Wall Scanner; StudScan Detects Edges of Wood/Metal Studs at 3/4” DeepScan Detects Wood/Metal to 1 1/2” Alerts Presence of Live, Unshielded AC Wire US Model
product_meta.description: Size:Edge Finding| Style:A100The StudSensor A100 is Zircon’s newest edge locating electronic stud finder that is sold exclusively on Amazon. The A100 is designed with a smooth, ergonomic rubber grip allowing for a comfortable yet secure hold for any size hand, at any angle. This stud finder uses the most recent technology in density detecting software and circuitry. The scanner has 2 scanning modes to locate the edges of wood and metal studs and joists behind walls, floors, and in ceilings up to 1.5 inches (38 mm) deep. In StudScan Mode, the SS A100 locates the edges of shallower wood or metal studs up to 0.75 of an inch (19 mm) deep. Switch over to DeepScan Mode to double the scanning depth to 1.5 inches (38 mm). This stud sensor is programmed with a Wire Warning Detection feature that indicates the presence of live unshielded electrical wires up to 2 inches (50 mm) deep when using either stud scanning modes. Finding studs using this edge finding tool is simple. To get started, install one brand new 9V alkaline battery (not included). Place the unit flat against the wall and press the Power Button to calibrate the sensor. Once you hear a beep indicating calibration is complete, continue to hold the Power Button and slowly slide the tool across the surface. The easy-to-read LCD will alert you as the stud detector approaches the edge of the stud in both scanning modes. Once the edge is detected, the patented arrow-shaped SpotLite Pointer will shine, the translucent base will illuminate, and an audio tone will sound. DO NOT DRILL HERE! Instead, mark the spot in the “V’ marker groove at the head of the tool and continue past the stud. Repeat the process in the opposite direction and mark the opposite edge of the stud. The center of the stud is midway between the two marks. Make sure to note whether the Wire Warning Detection is alerting you to live, unshielded AC wiring before drilling between the two marks into the center of the stud. With the Zircon StudSensor A100, you can safely maneuver through the most complicated of projects with the professional confidence that comes from owning a Zircon.
feature_bullets: The Zircon SS A100 electronic stud scanner is sold exclusively on Amazon and detects the edges of wood and metal studs up to 1.5 inches (38 mm) deep
Wire Warning Detection indicates the presence of live, unshielded electrical AC wiring while scanning in StudScan and DeepScan modes
Patented "over the stud" indicator and spotlite pointing system ensure the A100 provides trustworthy results
Ergonomically designed grip allows a comfortable hold on the tool for any size hand, at any angle
One fully charged 9V battery, not included, is required for the stud scanner to run at optimal performance to help you easily find studs and avoid hazards

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,953 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
